clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Radiation Oral Mucositis in Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma(NPC) Patients Treated With Combined Radio-Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Predictor Analysis Intervention of Acute Radiation Oral Mucositis in NPC Patients Treated With Combined Radio-Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: Radiation induced oral mucositis which may result in reduced quality of life is commonly seen during radiotherapy, especially combined with chemotherapy. This study is a prospective, multicenter, and exploratory study. The aim of this study is to explore predictive factors of acute radiotherapy induced oral mucositis in nasopharyngeal carcinoma patients treated with radio-chemotherapy and reduce incidence of oral mucositis by using recombinant human interleukin -11.

detailed_description.textblock: All nasopharyngeal patients received radical treatment including neo-adjuvant chemotherapy and concurrent chemo-radiotherapy. Oral pharyngeal swabs and stool specimen were collected 3times:before neo-adjuvant chemotherapy,before concurrent chemo-radiotherapy and concurrent chemo-radiotherapy finishied. Patients were randomly divided into two groups randomly. IL-11 was used in experience group and control group, saline.

primary_outcome.measure: the highest grade of oral mucositis
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5mouth
primary_outcome.description: Radiation Therapy Oncology Group/European Organization for research and treatment acute radiation morbidity scoring criteria. Grade 0: No change over baseline, Grade 1: Injection/ may experience mild pain not requiring analgesic, Grade 2: Patchy mucositis which may produce an inflammatory serosanguinitis discharge/ may experience moderate pain requiring analgesia, Grade 3: Confluent fibrinous mucositis/ may include severe pain requiring narcotic, Grade 4: Ulceration, hemorrhage or necrosis, Grade 5: death (Higher score equals to worse outcome).

arm_group.description: Mixture of 1.5 mg recombinant human interleukin -11(IL-11) and 2ml 0.9% normal saline(NS) was administered twicely to patients through respiratory tract.
Only 2ml 0.9% NS was administered twicely to patients through respiratory tract.

intervention.description: Recombinant Human Interleukin-11 was administed through respiratory tract.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Clinical diagnosis of nasopharyngeal carcinoma.
2. 7th version American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) stage I-IVB.
3. Age must beetween 18-70.
4. Performance status must be 0 or 1 according to Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group.
5. Adequate bone marrow, renal, and hepatic function.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Treatment with palliative intent.
2. Previous malignancy.
3. Pregnancy or lactation.
4. A history of previous radiotherapy, chemotherapy, or surgery (except diagnostic) to the primary tumor or nodes.
5. Diabetes, oral mucositis and senile dry stomatitis.
6. Any severe coexisting disease.
